DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to estimate the intracranial pressure (ICP, the pressure in your head) in subjects with intracranial hypotension (a condition caused by leakage of the fluid that surrounds your brain and spine) using non-invasive magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) techniques, and to determine whether changes in estimated ICP are seen after treatment of this condition.
DOC.brief_title: Non-invasive Estimation of CSF Pressure Using MRI in Patients With Spontaneous Intracranial Hypotension
